model

Class TurnsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.TurnsManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class TurnsManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the turns handler and is in charge of the logic of the problem. For more details about the context of the problem and the problem itself, got to: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d--ndivkbnoNeZ0nUT8eUpYm-FtVlvE13vZZVe3kn4g/edit?usp=sharing
    Author:
    Sebastián García Acosta
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • EXPONENT_OF_POSSIBLE_NUMBER_OF_DIGITS

        public static final int EXPONENT_OF_POSSIBLE_NUMBER_OF_DIGITS
        Number of integer places for codes generated. E.g., if numberOfPossibleDigits = 2, then the possible codes are 26 x 10!/(10 - 2) = 11793600 (11 million possible codes)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NUMBER_OF_POSSIBLE_IDS

        public static final long NUMBER_OF_POSSIBLE_IDS

      • turns

        private java.util.ArrayList<model.Turn> turns
        ArrayList containing the turns registered. Its length could be longer than users ArrayList due to the fact that a user can have multiple turns throughout the application life.

    • Method Detail

      • factorial

        public static long factorial(int number)

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String n,
                    java.lang.String s,
                    java.lang.String id,
                    java.lang.String tod,
                    java.lang.String cpn,
                    java.lang.String a,
                    model.Turn t)
             throws CustomExceptions.UserAlreadyRegisteredException,
                    CustomExceptions.BlankRequiredFieldException,
                    CustomExceptions.InvalidInputException
        Adds a user to the turns manager if and only if potential user's fields meet the following rules:
        Parameters:
        n, - String, name. REQUIRED FIELD. Must be alphabetic.
        s, - String, surnames. REQUIRED FIELD. Must be alphabetic.
        id, - String id. REQUIRED FIELD. Must be numerical.
        tod, - String, type of document. REQUIRED FIELD. Possible values: CC, CE, PA, TI, RC (see User class for detailed explanation).
        cpn, - String cell-phone number. Must be numerical.
        a, - String, address. Optional field.
        t, - Turn, turn assigned to user. Initially is null. All parameters (n, s, id, cpn, a, t) are not null. post: User was added successfully if all required fields were not blank, all fields were in their corresponding format, and its id was unique. Otherwise, the corresponding exception was thrown.
        Throws:
        CustomExceptions.UserAlreadyRegisteredException - if another user with same id is found.
        CustomExceptions.BlankRequiredFieldException - if one of the REQUIRED FIELDS indicated is blank.
        CustomExceptions.InvalidInputException - if one of the numeric fields indicated above as numerical does not contain only numbers.

      • registerTurn

        public void registerTurn(java.lang.String usrId,
                         int turnTypeIdx)
                  throws CustomExceptions.UserAlreadyHasATurnException,
                         CustomExceptions.UserNotFoundException,
                         CustomExceptions.BannedUserException
        Registers next available turn to user with id and turn type specified.
        Parameters:
        usrId, - String, identification number of user to whom the turn will be assigned. Cannot be null. post: turn was registered successfully if parameter was not null, user was found and didn't have a turn assigned already; otherwise, corresponding exception was thrown. After setting turn to user, lasTurn was updated.
        Throws:
        CustomExceptions.UserNotFoundException - if user with the specified id is not found.
        UserAlreadyHasATurnException, - if user already has a turns assigned.
        BannedUserException, - if user is within the days of suspension period
        CustomExceptions.UserAlreadyHasATurnException
        CustomExceptions.BannedUserException

      • allTurnsWereAttended

        public boolean allTurnsWereAttended()
        Answers whether all turns were already attended.
        Returns:
        boolean, answer if all turns were attended.

      • attendAllTurnsUpToTheCurrentDateTime

        public void attendAllTurnsUpToTheCurrentDateTime()
                                          throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Attends all turns pending until the current datetime, randomly assigning the state of every turn.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

      • sendTurnsQueue

        public java.lang.String sendTurnsQueue()
        Returns a string summarizing the pending turns to be attended.
        Returns:
        String, table containing the information about the pending turns to be attended.

      • getTurnTypes

        public java.util.ArrayList<model.TurnType> getTurnTypes()
        Returns:
        the turnTypes

      • generateNextTurnId

        public static java.lang.String generateNextTurnId(java.lang.String currTurnId)
        Generates next turn id ranging from A + 10!/(10 - 7) to Z + 10!/(10 - 7).
        Parameters:
        currentTurn, - Turn, previous turn, based on this the next turn will be generated. E.g. if currentTurn was A0, next turn will be A1; if currentTurn was Z99, next turn will be A00.
        Returns:
        String, id of the next turn. Its first character is a letter and the rest are numbers.

      • dispatchTurn

        public void dispatchTurn(model.Turn turn,
                         java.lang.String state)
                  throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Dispatches the current turn: sets the state of current turn to either ATTENDED or USER_NOT_PRESENT.
        Parameters:
        state, - String, possible values are: "Attended." or "User not present". post: After update the state of the current turn, user that had that turn could register another turn. (User's field Turn will be set to null).
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException, - if there are no turns registered whose state is ON_HOLD, i.e. all turns registered were already dispatched.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

      • consultNextTurnToBeAttended

        public model.Turn consultNextTurnToBeAttended()

        Consults what is the next turn to be attended.
        Returns:
        Turn, next turn to be attended.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

      • getCurrentTurn

        public model.Turn getCurrentTurn()
                          throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Return the first turn that has not be dispatched.
        Returns:
        Turn, the first turn that has not been dispatched.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException, - if all turns are already dispatched, i.e. there are no turns waiting to be attended.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException

        Generates up to 1000² unique random names based on the ones hosted in /data folder.
        Parameters:
        number, - number of random composed names to be created.
        Returns:
        ArrayList that contains the random names generated. Its size is number - 1.
        Throws:
        IOException, - if file archive could not be loaded.

      • loadNames

        public void loadNames()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Stores the names allocated in names.txt file into NAMES array for later using if and only if NAMES array is empty. post: This method will be executed only once in the lifetime of the program.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
